item.title: Deliberately curating an idiosyncratic vocabulary
item.description: The arrival of LLMs has made it painfully clear that certain kinds of complex cognition are surprisingly straightforward to replicate. I fall for trick questions I have an embarrassingly limited working memory I write bad code that needs to be debugged As more cognition can be outsourced, what novel thoughts does that leave for me? How do I have an idea that nobody else can have? I want to develop an eccentric, powerful vocabulary.
